decks.notes: The deck is focused on utilizing the creature type Elves to generate mana and draw cards quickly, using cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote to create explosive combos. The main win condition is to cast Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith to fetch Craterhoof Behemoth and overrun the opponent with a massive amount of damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Scavenging Ooze and Reclamation Sage to handle threats from the opponent. The synergy between the various Elves and support cards allow for explosive, fast-paced gameplay.

This deck focuses on locking down opponents with powerful artifacts like Blood Moon, Trinisphere, and Chalice of the Void, while using aggressive creatures like Sin Prodder and Magus of the Moon to apply pressure. Ensnaring Bridge helps protect against attacks, while cards like Fiery Confluence provide versatile removal options. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Koth of the Hammer to further control the game and deal damage. The goal is to disrupt opponents' strategies while hitting them hard with fast, aggressive creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently infect your opponent by using cards like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent in combination with pump spells like Invigorate and Berserk. The deck also includes ways to protect your creatures with counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as cards like Vines of Vastwood. The goal is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with infect damage before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in order to achieve victory as quickly as possible.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Food Chain combo to generate infinite mana with the creatures Walking Ballista, Misthollow Griffin, and Eternal Scourge. With the help of cards like Manipulate Fate and Brainstorm to dig for combo pieces, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Abrupt Decay, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and interact with the opponent's strategy. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides additional value and control elements to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Thespian's Stage. This allows the player to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token that can win the game in just one attack. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to help protect the combo, as well as cards like Pithing Needle and Ghost Quarter to deal with opposing threats. It aims to execute its combo efficiently and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure victory.

The main focus of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer, while using disruptive spells like Stifle and Force of Will to control the game. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures, backed up by a suite of cantrips and counterspells to maintain tempo and protect its threats. By effectively managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, this deck looks to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck aims to control the game through disruption and card advantage while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. It combines disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Daze with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent, supported by card draw from Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. The inclusion of Punishing Fire provides additional removal and reach. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination while also providing access to utility lands like Wasteland and Grove of the Burnwillows. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a midrange strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card manipulation and powerful removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. By using cards like Predict and Portent to draw and filter through their deck, as well as counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell to disrupt their opponent's strategy, the player aims to maintain control of the game until they can either win through incremental advantage or by casting a powerful finisher like Entreat the Angels or Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value from cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Snapcaster Mage. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile creatures like Baleful Strix to maintain board presence and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to support its three-color strategy.

The deck is focused on using Aluren to combo off by playing creatures for free or at a reduced cost. It includes a mix of value creatures like Shardless Agent and Baleful Strix to generate card advantage and disruption in the form of Force of Will and Leovold. The mana base is built around fetching the necessary dual lands to support the multicolor creatures. The goal is to efficiently cycle through the deck using cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, while controlling the game with creatures and disruption spells.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's spells and abilities, the deck sets up a strong board presence with Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp to close out the game quickly. With powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent while utilizing cards like Karakas and Aether Vial for versatility and protection. The deck's strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's plans and capitalizing on efficient creatures and equipment.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying aggressive pressure with efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to disrupt the opponent's plays, the deck aims to control the game and deny the opponent resources. Additionally, the deck has various ways to generate card advantage and tempo swings with cards like Flickerwisp and Stoneforge Mystic. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull further enhances the deck's aggressiveness and provides additional ways to close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their strategy through the use of disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Liliana of the Veil. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, while also keeping the opponent on their toes with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. The combination of efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Tombstalker ensures a fast clock for the opponent to deal with.

This combo deck aims to quickly ramp into playing powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by using cards like Sneak Attack and Show and Tell. The deck also includes plenty of card draw, counterspells, and protection to ensure the combo goes off smoothly. The key strategy is to cheat out big creatures for free or cheaply, overwhelming the opponent with massive threats early in the game. The deck is highly efficient and aims to win the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to react effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana using rituals and mana sources like Lion's Eye Diamond, then dig through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the combo pieces needed to win the game. Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize can disrupt the opponent's game plan while Infernal Tutor can search for key cards like Tendrils of Agony to finish the game. Past in Flames is used to flashback spells from the graveyard and continue the storm combo. The deck aims to efficiently build up storm count and cast Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of cheap, efficient creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Delver of Secrets to apply early pressure, alongside direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Force of Will and Daze provide protection and disruption, while card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help ensure a consistent flow of threats and answers. This deck seeks to win through aggressive, tempo-based gameplay.
